author: Staff Reporter
text:
A wreath laying ceremony was organised at the Madras Regiment War memorial at Wellington in The Nilgiris on Thursday to mark Army Day.

The wreath was laid by Lieutenant General S. Pattabhiraman (retired) to pay homage to war heroes.

There were many veterans also present.

Army Day is celebrated on January 15 every year in recognition of the then Lieutenant General K.M. Cariappa (later Field Marshal) who took over as the first Commander-in-Chief of Indian Army from the last British Commander, Sir Francis Butcher, on the same day in 1948.
title: Army Day observed
